slides.title: Goal
slides.text:
Every first-order linear differential equation can be transformed into a direct integration problem, but how?

Click "Next" to find out.
Multiply the original equation by an unknown function (the integrating factor) that makes a path to our goal of reversing the product rule.
Now, working backwards, apply the product rule to the left side of our final goal equation. This will bridge the gap between our starting equation and goal.
The equations that meet in the middle are identical except for the boxed expressions. This tells us that the μ we are looking for is the one that makes the boxes equal.
The condition that requires the boxed expressions to be equal is in the form of a separable differential equation that we can solve to get the integrating factor, μ!
